text: here's a kitchen conundrum I know you
all experienced a brownie a lemon bar a
blondie that's been stuck in your pan
where you can't get it out and you have
to cut it in the pan I'm going to show
you my favorite trick for getting your
brownies out of the pan and that starts
with parchment paper so a little bit of
softened butter brush all around your
pan now this could be a 9 by 13 any
rectangular or square pan just make sure
you brush up the sides and then I have
some cut parchment here and have it cut
about as wide as your pan even a little
bit smaller is great so that it doesn't
curl up on the sides give the paper fold
in half and the center crease goes right
in the middle press down into the butter
and make sure that the paper is stuck to
the pan fold over these ears and then
you need to brush the parchment itself
otherwise the next layer isn't going to
stick so make sure you really brush this
and same process fold paper in half
align it with the middle of the pan and
then give it a nice press into the pan
and just to make sure the parchment
doesn't stick to your brownie butter
this next layer now for security I like
to use these binder clips just to keep
the parchment paper down on the side so
that it doesn't fall over into your
brownie batter while it's baking so your
pan is perfectly lined with parchment
and all you need to do is add the
brownie batter so the brownies are out
of the oven if you're doing lemon bars
make sure that they're really well
chilled remove the binder clips and I'm
going to show you how easy it is to get
this out of the pan so gently nudge the
parchment up to loosen it from the sides
and then you should be able to easily
pop it right out of the pan and there
you have it perfectly square brownies
that you're ready to cut
nothing stuck to the pan parchment
that's the secret to making better bar
cookies
hey guys thanks for watching do you have
a kitchen conundrum that you need solved
well if you do write in the comment
section below and as always click
Subscribe
